contents.contents: Walk along the “Rue Saint Thibault”. At some point on your left, you will find a spot from where you can contemplate the Abbey of the Cordelières.

This abbey was founded by Thibaud IV of Champagne in the 13th century and was erected outside the ramparts of the upper town in front of its palace. In 1749, Louis XV decided it should be turned into a hospital. Today, it contains the archives of the Direction du Patrimoine et des Monuments (Ministry for National Heritage and Monuments) as well as a tourism school.
